poem:
### Gaza Mourning

Amidst the rubble, silence speaks;  
The world echoes outrage  
As truth falls, a casualty  
Beneath indifferent skies.  

In the courtyard, shadows gather—  
A procession of grief  
For voices silenced by ruin.  
In the distance, a child  
Lifts their gaze, questioning.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Mourners gather amid outrage over Israeli troops’ killing of journalists in Gaza – as it happened 6.02pm BST Closing summary Gazans gathered on Monday for the funeral of five Al Jazeera staff members and a sixth reporter killed in an Israeli strike, AFP reports. Dozens stood amid bombed-out buildings in the courtyard of Al-Shifa hospital to pay their respects to Anas al-Sharif, a prominent Al Jazeera correspondent aged 28, and four of his colleagues, killed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
